document.topic_text: One dead in U.S. 59 crash By Daily Globe Today at 9:45 p.m. SLAYTON -- One person was killed Thursday morning as a result of a pickup-motorcycle crash near the intersection of U.S. 59 and 30th Street. According to the Minnesota State Patrol, a 1974 Chevy pickup truck operated by Clarice L. Larson, 68, of Slayton, as well as a 2004 Yamaha motorcycle, were both traveling north on U.S. 59. The Chevy slowed to make a left-hand turn on 30th Street and was struck from behind by the motorcycle, the report said. Law enforcement officers were notified of the crash at 10:10 a.m. Friday. The operator of the motorcycle was killed in the crash, and the State Patrol noted that the individual’s identity would be released at 8 a.m. today. Larson had no apparent injury.
